contents:
I suggest you read the following paper which was co-authored by two key members of Wuhan Institute of Virology (Xing-Yi Ge, Zhengli-Li Shi): 
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4797993/

Note that a chimeric virus was developed by combining bat coronavirus SHC014 & SARS virus:
In this study, we examine the disease potential for SARS-like CoVs currently circulating in Chinese horseshoe bat populations. Utilizing the SARS-CoV infectious clone, we generated and characterized a chimeric virus expressing the spike of bat coronavirus SHC014 in a mouse adapted SARS-CoV backbone. The results indicate that group 2b viruses encoding the SHC014 spike in a wild type backbone can efficiently utilize multiple ACE2 receptor orthologs, replicate efficiently in primary human airway cells, and achieve in vitro titers equivalent to epidemic strains of SARS-CoV.


You may also check my previous comment https://pincong.rocks/article/item_id-256339

Update:
1. Soon after publishing the paper, there's a debate on whether such engineered bat virus only imposes unnecessary risk for human:
https://www.nature.com/news/engineered-bat-virus-stirs-debate-over-risky-research-1.18787
It is worth noticing that the chief designer of the experiment, Baric, said that "he plans to do further studies with the virus in non-human primates, which may yield data more relevant to humans."

2. A latest paper claims that "No credible evidence supporting claims of the laboratory engineering of SARS-CoV-2", where all 4 authors are from Ohio, US, including two Chinese
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7054935/
